Posted By: AnTzero (1/29/2011 7:26:19 AM)

posts.post_content:
On the question of "if two players have this out and one draws, what happens," each player draws multiples of two per card their opponent just drew until one decides not to draw any more. I think WotC anticipated the problem, since the text is "you *may* draw two cards," so basically you draw until one decides not to draw. However, the choice for each card an opponent draws is binary: 0 or 2. So if you draw 1, your opponent draws 2, you 4, them 8, you can then draw 0, 2, 4, 6, 8, 10, 12, 14, or 16 but not 1, 3, 5 etc.  
  
The really crazy thing about this card isn't just the ability on its own, which is great, but how badly it breaks so many cards. Any card you opponent plays with the word "draw" suddenly becomes a dead weight, since it actually puts them at a disadvantage (and god help them if they're running [Brainstorm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Brainstorm)). Unless your opponent is running cards that say "put into hand," [Archmage Ascension](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Archmage Ascension), or heavy discards, there's liter... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

posts.post_content:
This card is on par with [Rhystic Study](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rhystic Study) in terms of the sheer number of cards you can wind up drawing each turn, especially in multiplayer games. It doesn't seem like it at first, but man do you start drawing quickly once you really pay attention to how many random cantrips and such are included in commonly used cards.  
  
I have this in a deck alongside a few [Library of Leng](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Library of Leng) and [Ivory Tower](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ivory Tower)s. Generally once this guy comes out my hand size gets up to around 30-ish very quickly, and I'm gaining 26+ life per turn.
posts.html:
This card is on par with Rhystic Study in terms of the sheer number of cards you can wind up drawing each turn, especially in multiplayer games. It doesn't seem like it at first, but man do you start drawing quickly once you really pay attention to how many random cantrips and such are included in commonly used cards.

I have this in a deck alongside a few Library of Leng and Ivory Towers. Generally once this guy comes out my hand size gets up to around 30-ish very quickly, and I'm gaining 26+ life per turn.

posts.post_content:
I was playing a friend who [Phyrexian Metamorph](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Phyrexian Metamorph)ed this guy the turn after I cast him. We each drew more than ten cards the next turn.  
  
The fact that this guy is a 4/6 flyer (and therefore resistant to a lot of red removal, [dismember](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=dismember), or most combat damage) and has this ability is fantastic, and makes it nearly impossible to lose with him out. an absolutely bonkers card.

posts.post_content:
Just to clear up what happens when you and your opponent each have one in play:  
  
His draw step, he draws a card. This triggers your sphinx.  
You draw 2 cards when it resolves. His sphinx triggers twice.  
He draws 2 when the top trigger resolves, triggering yours twice.   
*The stack now has his, yours, yours. (bottom to top)*  
You draw 2 when the top resolves, triggering his twice again.  
*The stack now has his, yours, his, his. (bottom to top)*  
He draws 2. *(his, yours, his, yours, yours)*  
You decline to draw any more cards.  
You decline again.  
He draws 2 more cards. (adding 2 more to the stack)  
You decline again.  
You decline again.  
You decline a third time.  
He draws 2.  
You decline.  
You decline.  
  
You notice you have a [Leyline of Anticipation](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Leyline of Anticipation) on the battlefield and cast [Monomania](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Monomania)....
posts.html:
Just to clear up what happens when you and your opponent each have one in play:

His draw step, he draws a card. This triggers your sphinx.
You draw 2 cards when it resolves. His sphinx triggers twice.
He draws 2 when the top trigger resolves, triggering yours twice.
The stack now has his, yours, yours. (bottom to top)
You draw 2 when the top resolves, triggering his twice again.
The stack now has his, yours, his, his. (bottom to top)
He draws 2. (his, yours, his, yours, yours)
You decline to draw any more cards.
You decline again.
He draws 2 more cards. (adding 2 more to the stack)
You decline again.
You decline again.
You decline a third time.
He draws 2.
You decline.
You decline.

You notice you have a Leyline of Anticipation on the battlefield and cast Monomania....
